properties.title: Throgmorton Avenue
properties.description: Minor damage to the road sign which has been repaired. Splinters from a bomb that fell on the adjacent Carpenters Hall in 1941.

properties.title: St Paul's Cathedral
properties.description: Minor splintering on the Eastern wall of the Cathedral. Visible from the churchyard garden.

properties.title: St Bartholomew's Hospital
properties.description: Extensive damage to the wall facing Smithfield Square. Caused by Zeppelin raids on 8th September 1915.

properties.title: Mansell Street
properties.description: Splinter damage to the brickwork on the disused railway viaduct. Caused by WW2 bomb.

properties.title: Lincoln's Inn - Old Square
properties.description: Damage to the chapel walls caused by a bomb dropped during the Zeppelin raid of 13th October 1915 at 9.25pm.

properties.title: Lincoln's Inn - Stone Buildings
properties.description: Extensive splinter damage to buildings on both sides of the road. Sustained during Gotha raid on 18th December 1917.

properties.title: The Monument
properties.description: Minor damage and repairs to the Monument to the Great Fire of London. Sustained during WW2 blitz.

properties.title: Portugal Street
properties.description: Sign on the former head office of WH Smith damaged during a raid on 10th October 1940.

properties.title: St Clement Danes Church
properties.description: Extensive damage to the NE wall of St Clement Danes, the RAF church. Caused during WW2.

properties.title: Grant Museum
properties.description: Grant Zoology Museum (part of UCL). Bomb damage repairs to the stonework. Visible from Gower Street.

properties.title: Cleopatra's Needle
properties.description: Damage to the base of Cleopatra's needle and to the bronze statues. Caused during the Gotha raids of WW1.

properties.title: Lord Kitchener's Statue
properties.description: South end of Horse Guards Parade. Minor damage to the base of the statue and the screen behind.

properties.title: Guards Memorial
properties.description: Western end of Horse Guards Parade. WWI war memorial damaged by WW2 bomb.

properties.title: Edward VII statue
properties.description: Extensive damage on the Eastern side of the plinth. Sustained during WW2.

properties.title: Tate Britain
properties.description: Extensive damage on the Western side of the Tate Britain. Sustained during WW2.

properties.title: V&A Museum, South Kensington
properties.description: Extensive damage to the V&A museum along Exhibition Road. Sustained during WW2.

properties.title: Purdey Shop, Mayfair
properties.description: Moderate damage to the outside of James Purdey & Sons gunsmiths. Sustained in April 1941.

properties.title: London Street, Paddington
properties.description: Minor WW2 blitz damage to a brick wall on London Street in Paddington.

properties.title: Kew Bridge
properties.description: Damage to the stonework on the central span of Kew Bridge. Sustained during WW2.
